testcase.purpose: Check the effective port1 of the created MessageChannel
Check the effective port2 of the created MessageChannel
Check Channel Message invalid channel
Check if the MessageChannel.port1 attribute exists
Check if the MessageChannel.port1 attribute is readonly
Check if the MessageChannel.port2 attribute exists
Check if the MessageChannel.port2 attribute is readonly
Check if MessageEvent.data return the initialized value
Check that the MessageEvent.data attribute must be initialized to null if the object is created
Check if the MessageEvent.data attribute exists
Check if the MessageEvent.data attribute is readonly
Check that the MessageEvent.lastEventId attribute must be initialized to the empty string if the object is created
Check if the MessageEvent.lastEventId attribute exists
Check if the MessageEvent.lastEventId is readonly
Check if the MessageEvent.origin return the initialized value
Check that the MessageEvent.origin attribute must be initialized to the empty string if the object is created
Check if the MessageEvent.origin attribute exists
Check if the MessageEvent.origin attribute is readonly
Check if the MessageEvent.ports return the initialized value
Check that MessageEvent.ports attribute must be initialized to empty object if the object is created
Check if the MessageEvent.ports attribute exists
Check if the MessageEvent.port attribute is readonly
Check if the MessageEvent.source return the initialized value
Check that the MessageEvent.source attribute must be initialized to null if the object is created
Check if the MessageEvent.source attribute exists
Check if the MessageEvent.source attribute is readonly
Check if the MessagePort.close() method exists
Check that it will not receive message if port1 invoke close method
Check that it will not receive message if port2 invoke close method
Check if the type of MessagePort.close is function
Check if the MessagePort.onmessage attribute exists
Check that the port2 will receive the message form port1 if the port1 send message port2 by method of MessagePort.onmessage
Check that the port1 will receive the message form port2 if the port2 send message port1 by method of MessagePort.onmessage
Check if the MessagePort.postmessage is with port1 and port2 of MessageChannel
Check if the MessagePort.postMessage method exists
Check if the MessagePort.postmessage method if no args
Check if the MessagePort.postmessage method args is able to be null
Check if the MessagePort.port1 will not receive message that from itself
Check if the type of MessagePort.postmessage is a function
Check if the MessagePort.start method exists
Check if MessagePort.start method,if port1 invoke start method,it will still receive message
Check if MessagePort.start method,if port2 invoke start method it will receive message
Check if the type of the MessagePort.start is function
Check if W3C web message is able to send to wrong origin1
Check if W3C web message is able to send to wrong origin2
Check if W3C web message is able to send to wrong origin3
Check if W3C web message is able to send and receive
Check if W3C web message is able to send specical msg
Check that the value of eventsource.data is 'ok' if window.postMessage method is triggered
Check if window.postMessage method support a parent page send message to a child page
Check that the value of eventsource.data is empty string if window.postMessage method be set to empty string
Check that the value of eventsource.data is null if window.postMessage method be set to null
Check if a child page is able to send message to the parent page
Check if the type of window.postMessage method is function
Check if the type of MessageChannel.port1 is MessagePort object
Check if the type of MessageChannel.port2 is MessagePort object
Check if the type of MessageEvent.lastEventId is string
Check if the type of MessageEvent.origin is string
Check if the type of MessageEvent.ports is the MessagePort array
Check if the type of MessageEvent.source is the WindowProxy of the source window
Check if the type of MessagePort.onmessage is function
Check that a DataCloneError exception is to be thrown if the message argument of window.postMessaging() could not be cloned
Check if the type of the message parameter of the postMessage function is ArrayBuffer and the message can send and receive in normally
Check if the type of the message parameter of the postMessage function is date and the message can send and receive in normally
Check if the type of the message parameter of the postMessage function is FileBlob and the message can send and receive in normally
Check if the type of the message parameter of the postMessage function is FileList and the message can send and receive in normally
Check if the type of the message parameter of the postMessage function is number and the message can send and receive in normally
Check that a SynctaxError exception to be thrown if the value of the targetOrigin parameter of postmessage is invalid
Check if a port message queue can be enabled or disabled, and is initially disabled
Check if the first time a MessagePort object's onmessage IDL attribute is set, the port's port message queue must be enabled, as if the start() method had been called
Check if when the user agent is to clone a port original port, with the clone being owned by owner, it must return a new MessagePort object
Check if data sent through remote port is received by the new cloned port
Check if throw a DataCloneError when a host object is used with postMessage
Check if it will create an event that uses the MessageEvent interface
Check if using the postMessage() method make new ports into a read only array
Check if let target port be the port with which source port is entangled
Check if postMessage with Document object: Throw a DataCloneError if message could not be cloned
Check if postMessage with Function object: Throw a DataCloneError if message could not be cloned

Check if the value of the targetOrigin argument is neither a single U+002A ASTERISK character (*), a single U+002F SOLIDUS character (/), nor an absolute URL, then throw a SyntaxError exception and abort the overall set of steps

step.step_desc: Check if the value of the targetOrigin argument is neither a single U+002A ASTERISK character (*), a single U+002F SOLIDUS character (/), nor an absolute URL, then throw a SyntaxError exception and abort the overall set of steps

Check if the targetOrigin argument is a single literal U+002F SOLIDUS character (/), and the Document of the Window object on which the method was invoked does not have the same origin as the entry script's document, then abort these steps silently

step.step_desc: Check if the targetOrigin argument is a single literal U+002F SOLIDUS character (/), and the Document of the Window object on which the method was invoked does not have the same origin as the entry script's document, then abort these steps silently

testcase.purpose: Check that cross-origin: Origin of the target window doesn't match the given origin
Check that same-origin: Origin of the target window doesn't match the given origin

Check if MessageEvent interface exists
Check if MessagePort interface exists
